One thing that causes a "hang" -- tight loop -- 
seems to be trying to equilibrate a mixture which has no thermodynamics -- 
eg, something like this...

      set(g, T=kelvin, P=OneAtm * .1, X="AR")
      g.equilibrate('TP')

Clearly, the species mixture  has no dependence on temperature, pressure, or anything else.
It's already (always) at equilibrium.

So all derivatives of the state with respect to anything are zero.

This makes me wonder if the code that determines that an equilibrium has been reached, needs tweaking.
